page.description: The INET::Socket::ReadUntil() method reads from the input stream until the delimiter is encountered or a timeout occurs. If the function returns FALSE, there may still be data in the returned buffer. This means that the read timed-out before receiving the delimiter. If ReturnDelimiter is true, the delimiter is returned with the string.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = ReadUntil(Data BYREF as C, Delimiter as C [, ReturnDelimiter as L] [,Timeout as N [, ReleaseXBasic as L = .t.]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: TRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.).

argument.name: Data
argument.description: The data received from the connection.

argument.name: Delimiter
argument.description: The character that defines a logical segment of the data, such as a CR-LF that ends a line.

argument.name: ReturnDelimiter
argument.description: Indicates whether to include the Delimiter in the Data.

item.name: .T. (TRUE) = The returned string contains the delimiter.
.F. (FALSE) = The returned string does not contain the delimiter.

argument.name: Timeout
argument.description: The number of seconds before the method returns.
